Some of u may notice that i type in a slightly unusual way.  I always capitalize the first letter of every sentence, i always use correct punctuation, and i try hard to make all of my writing grammatically correct.  However, i do not capitalize the "i" unless it is at the beginning of a sentence, i say "u" instead of spelling out the word "you," and i do not use spell check.  This is because i find it very relaxing to not have to worry about the capital "i" and minor rules of spelling.  I do find it relaxing to throw out all rules of grammar but i am also disturbed by a feeling of unintelligence which outweighs the relaxing feeling.  So i have discovered that this way of typing keeps me at the optimal level of relaxation and intelligence for a journal such as this.  I think it is very healthy for others to adopt a style of writing that conforms to their optimal levels.  It is true that some people may only be relaxed if everything is absolutely grammatically correct.  Others may find that they are quite pleased with work that is hardly grammatically correct at all.  I have found the style that suits me and i would encourage everyone to find the style that suits them.
